intro: Ceropegia loeseneriana, commonly known as the string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting specific pollinators like moths. It is a succulent, capable of storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves, making it drought-tolerant. Ceropegia loeseneriana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
